defs: a man who behaves or thinks imprudently or unwisely; a silly person; a fool; a stupid.

ಗಂಟಲು ಒಡೆ gaṇṭalu oḍe (voice of boys) to become hoarse (on entering their teen age); ಗಂಟಲ ಕುಹರ gaṇṭala kuhara = ಗಂಟಲ ಕುಳಿ; ಗಂಟಲ ಕುಳಿ gaṇṭala kuḷi the muscular and membranous cavity of the alimentary canal leading from the mouth and nasal passages to the larynx and oesophagus; the pharynx;ಗಂಟಲ ಗಾಣ gaṇṭala gāṇa = ಗಂಟಲ ಗಾಳ; ಗಂಟಲ ಗಾಳ gaṇṭala gāḷa (fig.) a device, technique or person used as fatal instrument or which proves to be deadly to another; ಗಂಟಲ ಮಣಿ gaṇṭala maṇi the projection formed in men in the front of the throat by the thyroid cartilage; ಒಂದೇ ಗಂಟಲಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರಾಣ ಇಟ್ಟುಕೊಂಡಿರು ondē gaṇṭalalli prāṇa iṭṭukoṇḍiru (said of two person) to be very close, intimate; to be cheek by jowl; ಗಂಟಲಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಅನ್ನ/ನೀರು ಇಳಿಯದಿರು gaṇṭalinalli anna/nīru iḷiyadiru to be not able to have one's food in the normal manner, as from grief, emotion, etc.; ಗಂಟಲು ಕೊಯ್ಯು gaṇṭalu koyyu to cheat ruthlessly; ಗಂಟಲು ದೊಡ್ಡದು ಮಾಡು gaṇṭalu doḍḍadu māḍu to shout aloud; ಗಂಟಲು ಹರಿದುಕೊ gaṇṭalu hariduko to speak, advice in vain.
a complex,. perplexing, not-easy-solve situation.
to cause (the throat) to become chocked, blocked.
to cause (one's voice) to get stuck; to cause not to be expressed audibly or clearly (as from grief, joy, etc.).
(the throat) to become chocked, blocked.
(one's voice) to get stuck; to not come out; to not be expressed audibly or clearly (as from grief, joy, etc.).

the blood vessels on either side of the throat.
swelling or inflammation of these vessels (causing taking anything as food difficult).
air-passage from the throat to the lungs; the wind-pipe.
an intricate legal case, dispute, controversy, quarrel, etc. that is hard to untangle, solve or analyse.
a projection of the thyroid cartilage at the front of the neck that is more prominent in men than in women; the laryngeal eminence; the Adam's apple.
a condition, thing that makes drinking, swallowing food, etc. difficult.
a person who makes it difficult or impossible for another to get or earn his food.

a hole made in the lobe of the ear (for wearing ornaments).
a kind of ear-ornament.
a thick growth of plants, esp. grass.

to come to pass, happen; to occur.

a knuckle - a) the joint connecting a finger to the rest of the hand or the one connecting two foldable parts of a finger; a joint of the finger; b) the rounded knob formed by the bones at such a joint.
a lump or knob in a thread, cord, etc., formed by passing one free end through a loop and drawing it tight or by a tangle drawn tight; a knot.
a fastening made by intertwining or tying together pieces of string, cord, rope, hair, etc.
a number of things tied, wrapped or otherwise held together; a bundle, package or parcel.
amassed wealth or capital invested (in a business enterprise).
a place or part where two bones or corresponding structures are joined, usu. so that they can move; a joint.
connection of persons by blood, marriage, etc.; kinship.
a situation or condition which requires more effort or is difficult to solve, untangle or analyse.
an inflamed swelling of a lymph node, as in the armpit, groin, etc. from plague; a bubo.

a contagious disease, the most common form of plague, caused by a bacterium (Yersinia pestis) transmitted by fleas from infected rats, and characterised by buboes, fever, prostration, and delirium; bubonic plague. ಗಂಟಿನ ರೋಗ gaṇṭina rōga = ಗಂಟು - 10; ಒಂದೇ ಗಂಟಿನಲ್ಲಿ ondē gaṇṭinalli (paying, repaying etc. of entire money that is due) in lump sum; ಗಂಟು ಎತ್ತಿ ಹಾಕು gaṇṭu etti hāku to get money or property from (another) under false pretences; to cheat; to defraud; to swindle; ಗಂಟು ಕರಗು gaṇṭu karagu (one's savings, wealth) to be spent (usu. gradually); ಗಂಟು ನುಂಗು gaṇṭu nungu = ಗಂಟು ಎತ್ತಿ ಹಾಕು; ಗಂಟೂ ಉಳಿಯಲಿ, ನಂಟೂ ಉಳಿಯಲಿ ಎನ್ನು gaṇṭū uḷiyali, naṇṭū uḷiyali ennu (prov.) to desire to have the advantage of both alternatives; to eat one's cake and have it too; I love you, but touch not my pocket; ಗಂಟು ಮಾಡಿಕೊ gaṇṭu māḍiko (used sarc. or derog.) (fig.) to make (huge amount of ) money; ಗಂಟೂ ಹೋಯಿತು, ನಂಟೂ ಹೋಯಿತು gaṇṭū hōyitu, naṇtū hōyitu (prov.) in the process to gain something, he lost whatever he had; ಪಾಪಿಯ ಗಂಟು ಕಂಡವರಿಗೆ pāpiya gaṇṭu kaṇḍavarige (prov.) evil gotten, evil spent; ill-gotten wealth seldom spent proper; ಮುಖ ಗಂಟಿಕ್ಕು mukha gaṇṭikku to contract ones facial muscles and brows (as from strong disapproval, aversion, anger, etc.); ಮುಖ ಗಂಟುಹಾಕಿಕೊಳ್ಳು mukha gaṇṭu hākikoḷḷu = ಮುಖ ಗಂಟಿಕ್ಕು.
